Supporting:
Cause: In 2008, the Belizean government offered a concession for Belize Hydropower Development Company to conduct feasibility research within Bladen Nature Reserve.

The concession lasts for 15 years with possible 10-year extension (Foges 2010, Let our River Flow 2010),

“It is very concerning that we would even contemplate a dam in a nature reserve,” said Lisel Alamilla, the Executive Director of Ya’axché Conservation Trust. Ya’axché is considering taking the Government to the Supreme Court for an injunction if the activities inside Bladen Nature Reserve are allowed to proceed. They believe it is “a complete disregard for the Laws of Belize, specifically the National Parks Systems Act.” (Foges 2010)

In November of last year Ya’axché Conservation Trust discovered that Belize Hydroelectric Development (BHD) had conducted an illegal ‘feasibility study’ for a proposed hydroelectric dam within the pristine, strictly protected Bladen Nature Reserve. When this illegal activity was discovered, the Belizean Ministry of Natural Resources and Forest Department ceased their actions since they had no legitimate documents for their entrance and any other activities in any protected area. 

Later, however, BHD was granted access to the nature reserve through a research permit given by the Belize Forest Department signed by the Prime Minister himself to do a research of the area, which is the subject of this PADDD event (Let our River Flow 2010, McLoughlin 2010)
Sources:
Foges, R. (2010, January 21). Controversy sparked around Belize nature reserve. Fauna and Flora International. Retrieved from http://www.fauna-flora.org/news/controversy-sparked-around-belize-nature-reserve/

Let our River Flow. (2010, April 5). Thursday May 6th 2010 Court Date: Bladen Nature Reserve. Retrieved from http://letourriverflow.weebly.com/

McLoughlin, L. (2010). Saving paradise in the Maya Mountains of Belize. The Esperanza Project. Retrieved from http://theesperanzaproject.org/tag/bladen-nature-reserve/

Supporting:
This bill proposes to degazette Bom Futuro National Forest by repealing the decree that created it (No. 96,188, of June 21, 1988), on the basis that the decree overstepped the limits of executive power. The authors argue that the government did not conduct sufficient preliminary studies as required by law prior to the Forest’s gazettement (creation). Due to this, they argue, there are numerous unsettled land claims within the Forest.  

The authors state that there are more than 6000 farming families living amongst 3 villages within the Forest. They argue that the creation of the National Forest violated individual rights without due process of those who live within Bom Futuro, and that the Forest is detrimental to the local economy of the region (Amorim 2009).

Supporting:
In this bill (PL224/2006), Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  
The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009). On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.

primarynam: Rio Vermelho C State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentado Rio Vermelho \C\""
Supporting: Rio Vermelho C State Forest was degazetted in February 2014 due to a legislative decree passed by the State Assembely of Rodonia, which revoked its creation decree (no. 4.567 of 1990/3/23). This was a systemic PADDD event as the decree that was revoked created Rio Vermelho C State Forest, Jaci-Parana Extractive Reserve, Rio Madeira B State Forest, and Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area. Protected areas in the region face frequent pressure from illegal logging and cattle ranching. The degazettements were a response to the call from thousands of farmers who fear being evicted from these conservation areas, where they are residing illegally. by the government (Rodonia Juridico 2014). The Governor Confucio Moura signed the revocation decree. However, in April 2014 a court ruled a suspension of the degazettements, putting their status once again in limbo.
Sources: ISA. Rio Vermelho C State Forest. UCSocioambiental.  http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5783  ;   DECRETO LEGISLATIVO N.509 de 19/02/2014. http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1457_20140319_122207.pdf  ; Rodonia Juridico. 2014. Supporting:
The authors of the Proposed bill to degazette Cristópolis National Forest argue that its establishment was unlawful -- the government expropriated forest land that was, in reality, rural agricultural land with unsettled land titles. The authors argue that the land lacks the biological diversity required to establish a National Forest, and lacked a prior study on the issue, as required by Law 9985 of 2000, Law of the SNUC (Pinheiro et al. 2003). The authors explain their case as follows: To establish the National Forest, the government (via IBAMA, the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources) purchased 11,952 hectares of land from Fazendo Estandarte. In exchange, IBAMA gave Fazendo Estandarte 1,070,756 reforestation credits, which could be worth up to over R$3.5 million (~$1.6 million USD) in today’s market. It later became clear, as the authors argue, that Fazendo Estandarte had only 4,400 hectares of forested land, although they were paid for 11,952 hectares (Pinheiro et al. 2003).    As of 2012, the proposal is archived with the Presiding Officers of the House of Representatives (MESA).

Supporting: This law downsized Jaci-Paraná Extractive Reserve by excising  five areas totaling 2240.2638 hectares, for the flood zone of the San Antonio dam. The Extractive Reserve is located in the municipality of Porto Velho and created by Decree No. 7.335 of 17 January 1996 with its boundaries defined by Law No. 692, December 27, 1996. The Extractive Reserve Jaci-Paraná area shall now be 197364.1225 hectares.

Supporting:
This bill attempts to degazette the Pontões Capixabas National Park by suspending the decree which established the Park (unnumbered Decree of 19 December 2002). The authors of the bill question the legality of the Park's creation by Presidential decree, but do not mention the reason for the Proposed degazettement. Parque Nacional dos Pontões Capixabas, nos municípios de Pancas e Águia Branca, in the state of Espírito Santo, and other matters (Fraga 2005)   As of 2012, the proposal is filed with the Presiding Officers of the House of Representatives (MESA).....The National Park Pontoons Capixabas covers three distinct areas, with approximately 174.96 sq. km. (17,496 ha) (Gov. of Brazil 2002).  In 2006, however, National Park Pontões Capixabas was downgraded to National Monument Pontões Capixabas, a category which permits people living inside its boundaries (Bourscheit 2009).

PADDD_ID: AMAZÔNIA (nov 2018): \"As onze áreas protegidas de Rondônia foram criadas pelo governador anterior em 20 de março de 2018 [2]. Uma semana depois
Region: que é dominada por interesses do agronegócio
Country: aprovou por unanimidade uma lei revogando as 11 reservas
ISO3166: mas em julho o judiciário derrubou a lei que extinguiu as reservas [3]. Nesse meio tempo

Location_K: os deputados estaduais chegaram a um acordo com o novo governador: eles liberariam os fundos necessários para pagar os funcionários do governo estadual se o governador aprovasse a revogação da maior reserva — a Estação Ecológica Soldados da Borracha
PACODE: de 178.948 ha [4]. Na manhã de 25 de setembro
primarynam: o governador apresentou um projeto de lei ao legislativo propondo a revogação dessa reserva
allnames: mas os legisladores imediatamente acrescentaram uma emenda ao projeto de lei
EventType: extinguindo também as outras dez áreas protegidas
EnactedPro: e naquela mesma tarde aprovaram a lei que extinguiu todos os 11 reservas sem debate
YearPAGaze: bem como sem qualquer consulta pública ou estudo técnico [4]. Nos discursos celebrando a votação
YearPADDD: um dos líderes da Assembléia Legislativa declarou explicitamente que a Assembléia Legislativa é composta de “deputados ruralistas que têm compromissos com a sociedade de uma maneira geral do Estado de Rondônia

Size_Post: aprovando a revogação da Estação Ecológica Soldados da Borracha

Para constituir o novo perímetro, foram ampliados 152 mil hectares a oeste dos antigos limites da Resex, sobre o município de Ipixuna, e excluídos 40 mil hectares da antiga área. Segundo o deputado estadual David Almeida (PSD-AM), líder do governo na assembleia legislativa do Amazonas, essa área foi desafetada porque o estado não poderia arcar com a indenização de uma propriedade particular não identificada quando a UC foi criada, em 2007. Fonte: https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/reserva-extrativista-do-rio-gregorio-am-e-ampliada-em-mais-de-118-mil-hectares 

To form the new perimeter, 152 thousand hectares were extended west of the old limits of the Resex, on the municipality of Ipixuna, and excluded 40 thousand hectares of the old area. According to State Representative David Almeida (PSD-AM), the government leader in the legislature of Amazonas, this area was denied because the state could not afford the compensation of an unidentified private property when the CU was created in 2007. Source : https://www.socioambiental.org/en-us/noticias-socioambientais/reserva-extrativista-do-rio-gregorio-am-e-ampliada-em-more-of-118-mil-hectares

Supporting: In 2012 the Tapajós National Forest was downsized by a total of 17,851 hectares in order to excise two regions that had previous human settlements: to the northeast, the communities of Aveiro São Jorge, Nova Vida, Nossa Senhora de Nazaré e Santa Clara, along the margin of the BR-163 highway (total of 11,900 ha); and the urban area of the Aveiro municipality along the Tapajos river(total of 5,861 ha). Thus, the 60000 hectares that had since its inception, is replaced by 582 149 hectares. This is part of MP558/2012 which downsized multiple protected areas in the Tapajos region, primarily for hydropower development. The regions were excised to \Viabilizar a regularização de áreas das comunidades de Aveiro e São Jorge (PA).\" Map available from: http://confins.revues.org/7595#quotation"

allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental do Planalto Central
Supporting:
Reversal: PL1626/2007 Arquivada em 31 jan 2019
This bill (PL PL 1626 / 2007) proposes to transfer management responsibility of Planalto Central Environmental Protection Area from IBAMA (the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Natural Resources), to local governments of Governments of the Federal District and the State of Goiás. This transfer would allow more human activites than previously allowed. The authors cite the success of a previous bill which transfered management of Bacia do Rio São Bartolomeu Environmental Protection Area to local government, which allowed the subdivision of the area into condominiums. In 2012, the Committee on Environment and Sustainable Development rejected the proposal. However, the bill will still be considered by the Committee on Constitution, Justice and Citizenship (CCJ) and then proceed to the Plenary. the bill was previously approved by the Committee on Labor, Public Service and Administration in Septemeber 2009. A proposta foi desarquivada em 11/02/2015 e está aguardando designação de relator na CCJC.
Sources: Carvalho, Augusto. PL 1626. http://www.camara.gov.br/proposicoesWeb/fichadetramitacao?idProposicao=360008    ;       Camara dos Deputados. 2012. Comissão rejeita transferência da gestão de APA do Planalto Central. September 20. http://www2.camara.leg.br/camaranoticias/noticias/MEIO-AMBIENTE/426534-COMISSAO-REJEITA-TRANSFERENCIA-DA-GESTAO-DE-APA-DO-PLANALTO-CENTRAL.html

Supporting:
In this bill (PL224/2006), Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  
The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009)    On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.   
  
ORIGINAL TEXT: \Susta os efeitos dos decretos de 13 de fevereiro de 2006

primarynam: Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro Environmental Protection Area
allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental da Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro
Supporting: This bill altered the boundaries of PES Rio Negro Setor Sul and APA Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and created the RDS Puranga Conquista. The APA formerly had an area of 643.215 hectares (UCSocioambiental data; area was 623.33 ha according to ISA), and now has 611.008 ha. Thus the APA was downsized by 322.07 ha.  This downsize occurred when a 2001 bill that had expanded the park was revoked in March 2014 by Law 4015 (24/03/2014).The newly created RDS Puranga Conquista was created for the subsistence use of traditional populations, and has an area of 76,936 ha, partly overlapping in the regions downsized from the PES and APA. A new map shown on ISA's website (2014).
Sources: ISA. PES do Rio Negro Setor Sul. http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5545   ;  Diario Oficial. Lei 4015. 2014. March 24. Available from http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1466_20140401_142743.pdf

Supporting:
Although created in 1990 with the extension of 586,031 ha (Decree 4576 of 23/03/90), the issuance of purchase and sale ( CPCVs ) by INCRA in 1991 /1992, contracts resulted in a reduction of 152,215 ha of park land which originally protected the headwaters of the rivers that drain into the Park. Then, in 1996, the Legislature approved the Rondônia State Law no. 690 of 12.27.96 , which reduced the area of the park to 424,339 hectares, in order to legitimize the rural settlements whom had settled within the Park boundaries.
In 2002 , the Park was downsized again. On the last day of the term of former governor of Rondônia , Jose de Abreu Bianco , the Legislature approved the State Law no. 1,171 of 31/12/02 , excluding over 40,284 hectares of the park, to the benefit of large rural property owners. The 1996 and 2002 reductions in Corumbiara State Park total 201,975 hectares , representing 34 % of the original area of the conservation unit . The bills were approved in the absence of environmental impact studies (Instituto Socioambiental n.d.)
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Supporting:
In this bill, Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  

The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009)    On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.

Supporting: The bill to downsize Aredes Ecological Station passed on August 9, 2011 under Law nº 19 .555 (originally introduced at bill PL 1.759/11). The bill (Proposed by the governor) removed 9.33 hectares of Aredes Ecological Station between Itabirite and Ouro Preto, in order to build an alternative route for the transportation of iron ore by mining companies Vale and MBR. In return, the mining companies will donated 38.7 hectares of their land to be incorporated into the conservation area. The downsize was conditional on the land donation by the mining companies. The authors of the bill argued that the region's mineral wealth outweighs the importance of conservation in Aredes, and that excising this land would allow mining to continue without environmental permitting and compliance (Santiago 2012). On September 30, 2013, decree Nº 46 .322 (previously bill PL3.311/2012) described the new boundaries of Aredes Ecological Station. Aredes Ecological Station was created by Decree no. 45.397 of 2010 (June 14).
Notes: Lei  N° 19 .555 / 2011 (this passes the downsize. New boundaries described in DECRETO Nº 46 .322, DE 30 DE SETEMBRO DE 2013  (introduced as PL 311))

Supporting:
This bill, PDC 1148/2008, suspends the effects of the Decree of the President of the Republic of 13 February 2006 establishing the Jamanxim National Forest in the Municipality of Novo Progresso, Pará State.   
The Jamanxim National Forest, located in the Municipality Novo Progresso has an approximate area of 1,301,120 ha. Within the past 30 years, large areas of this National Forest have been deforested and are currently used as permanent pasture for cattle.   
Jamanxim National Forest is one of the most deforested protected areas in Amazonia, and has the most hotspots for wildfires. The region’s colonization was due, in part, to former government policy of encouraging landless farmers to colonize the region.   
The National Forest Jamanxim was created alongside of six other protected areas as a compromise on the creation of the BR-163 highway. All of these protected areas have experienced numerous conflicts over land ownership. The authors argue that its creation was unconstitutional in that it lacked adequate prior public consultation, and technical, socio-economic and environmental studies. Furthermore, the region is rich in mineral deposits. The authors contend that, “The preservation of the Amazon is not only desirable,but absolutely necessary. However, we should notonly see environmental preservation as an alternative for sustainable development of the region. In addition to the environmental issues involved, it is necessary to discuss the impact of the creation of new protected areas on the local economy and population.” The bill is currently pending with the Commission of Constitution and Justice and citizenship (CCJC).

Supporting:
The bill (PL6479/06) proposes to downsize and downgrade  Terra do Meio Ecological Station, and downsize Serra do Pardo National Park, in order to restore the rights of local people to continue living within the Park, which total over 2500 according to the bill. ESEC Terra do Meio was created in 2005 by Decreto - s/n - 17/02/2005 with 3,373.110 ha. This bill proposes to excise 4 different regions of the park: 3 of them in the southern region, totaling 405,070 ha will be excised to no protected status (and will purportedly be offset by equivalent land additions to the ESEC), and another 4th region of 1817 ha (to the north of Serra do Pardo) will be transferred to Serra do Pardo National Park, in order to offset the concurrent downsize there. This 4th region is thus effectively downgraded to a lower protected status.  In 2013, the bill was approved by the Committee on Constutionality, Justice, and Citizenship. Since 2011, the bill is currently being evaluated by several Commissions within the House of Representatives, and it was recently approved by the Commission on the Environment and Sustainable Development.. According to Martin et al. (2012), 1817 km2 will be affected by the PADDD proposal.

primarynam: Rio Madeira B State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentado do Rio Madeira \B\""
Supporting: Rio Madeira C State Forest was degazetted in February 2014 due to a legislative decree passed by the State Assembely of Rodonia, which revoked its creation decree (no. 4.567 of 1990/3/23). This was a systemic PADDD event as the decree that was revoked created Rio Vermelho C State Forest, Jaci-Parana Extractive Reserve, Rio Madeira B State Forest, and Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area. Protected areas in the region face frequent pressure from illegal logging and cattle ranching (). The degazettements were a response to the call from thousands of farmers who fear being evicted from these conservation areas, where they are residing illegally. by the government (Rodonia Juridico). The Governor Confucio Moura signed the revocation decree. However, in April 2014 a court ruled a suspension of the degazettements, putting their status once again in limbo.
Sources: ISA. Rio Madeira B State Forest. PADDD_ID: AMAZÔNIA (nov 2018): \"As onze áreas protegidas de Rondônia foram criadas pelo governador anterior em 20 de março de 2018 [2]. Uma semana depois
Region: que é dominada por interesses do agronegócio
Country: aprovou por unanimidade uma lei revogando as 11 reservas
ISO3166: mas em julho o judiciário derrubou a lei que extinguiu as reservas [3]. Nesse meio tempo

PACODE: de 178.948 ha [4]. Na manhã de 25 de setembro
primarynam: o governador apresentou um projeto de lei ao legislativo propondo a revogação dessa reserva
allnames: mas os legisladores imediatamente acrescentaram uma emenda ao projeto de lei
EventType: extinguindo também as outras dez áreas protegidas
EnactedPro: e naquela mesma tarde aprovaram a lei que extinguiu todos os 11 reservas sem debate
YearPAGaze: bem como sem qualquer consulta pública ou estudo técnico [4]. Nos discursos celebrando a votação
YearPADDD: um dos líderes da Assembléia Legislativa declarou explicitamente que a Assembléia Legislativa é composta de “deputados ruralistas que têm compromissos com a sociedade de uma maneira geral do Estado de Rondônia
Cause: mas principalmente com o agronegócio” [4]. Em 5 de outubro
Areaaffect: um grupo de 60 organizações não governamentais solicitou ao governador que vetasse a lei em sua totalidade [5]. Em 16 de outubro
Size_Pre: o governador emitiu um veto parcial
Size_Post: aprovando a revogação da Estação Ecológica Soldados da Borracha
IUCN_pre: mas rejeitando as cláusulas que extinguem as outras dez reservas [6]. A assembléia legislativa agora tem 30 dias úteis para votar a anulação do veto [7]. Dada à unanimidade dos votos anteriores

Estavam em risco o Parque Nacional de Brasília
Country: e o Parque Nacional de São Joaquim

Supporting: In February 2014, the opposition tried to vote on a bill repealing Amapá State Forest, which established in 2006. However, Brazil's Ministerio Publico (Public Prosecutor) recommended that they not revoke the Forest's creation decree, until the government has completed its process of land tenure tranfser. The Forest's lands are being transfered from federal to state ownership.  Without the State Forest, the lands would still belong to the Federal government. Due to this, the opposition has backed off of their efforts to degazette the Forest. The group of deputies who want to extinguish the State Forest is led by Eider Pena (PSD) (former PDT - member) who voted for the creation of the unit in 2006, when his political party was in power, under the Governor Waldez Goes (PDT). This movement to degazette the Forest began in earnest in June 6 2013, when a group of deputies of the State Legislative Assembly of Amapá, led by Eider Pena (PSD), convened a public hearing to try to repeal the Amapá State Forest. The current governor, Camilo Capiberibe (PSB) is strongly opposed to this movement. \Now
Sources: politicians who supported the creation of the State Forest want access to their stock of wood and more land to farm soybeans. The impetus behind the propopsal is the increasing difficulty in obtaining new local timber timber lands
Map_Details: and also the creation of a new port in Santana
Date_Add: the Bill will be considered by the land law committee
Last_Update: whom will forward a conclusive report to the Presiding Officers of the Legislative Assembly. The steering board of the Assembly has the final say on whether the project will or not be voted upon (Bragança 2014). The Amapá State Forest was created by an agreement proposed by President Lula in 2004: he would pass these lands to the state since they were transformed into the protected area. Thus was born this State Forest
AddedBy: with an area of 2.36 million hectares
isLatestVe: approximately 16.6% of the entire area of ​​Amapá.

PADDD_ID: “The state legislators of the Legislative Assembly of Amapá (Alap) removed from the agenda of this Monday session (17) the matter that repeals a law of 2006 to create the State Forest of Amapá (Flota). The measure was taken after Deputy Jorge Solomon (DEM) asked to withdraw the vote. The request was based on a recommendation from the Amapá Public Prosecutor's Office (MP / PA) that instructed MPs to abstain from voting until \"the process of transferring public land from the Union to Amapá has been completed.\"“ Original text:\"Os deputados estaduais da Assembleia Legislativa do Amapá (Alap) retiraram da pauta da sessão desta segunda-feira (17) a matéria que revoga uma lei de 2006 de criação da Floresta Estadual do Amapá (Flota). A medida foi tomada após o deputado Jorge Salomão (DEM) pedir a retirada da votação. A solicitação foi com base em uma recomendação do Ministério Público do Amapá (MP/AP) que orientou os deputados a se abster na votação até a \"conclusão do processo de transferência das terras públicas da União para o Amapá.\"\" (https://uc.socioambiental.org/noticia/no-ap-deputados-desistem-de-votar-revogacao-de-lei-que-cria-floresta)
The federal judge of the 6th Circuit Court of Amapá
Region: revoked the judicial decision of Judge João Bosco Costa Soares
allnames: the State Forest of Amapá (Fleet).” Original text:\"O juiz federal da 6ª Vara da Seção Judiciária do Amapá
EnactedPro: revogou a decisão judicial do juiz João Bosco Costa Soares que declarou

Supporting: Revoga a Lei no 8.680/2007, que dispunha sobre a ampliação das áreas da EE Rio Roosevelt e da Resex Guariba-Roosevelt. A EE passa de 96.168 hectares (área ISA: 97.455 hectares) para 53.000,65 hectares e a Resex de 138.092 hectares (área ISA: 136.161 hectares) para 57.630 hectares. A Lei determinou ainda a totalidade de ambas as UCs, uma área de 110.630 hectares para servir como reserva legal deslocada para a regularização fundiária e ambiental da área das \4 Reservas\"
Sources: situada nos Municípios de Terra Nova do Norte/MT e Nova Guarita/MT. Fonte: https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/5665        /

Notes:
Em 2015, numa decisão que foi revogada posteriormente pelo estado, a área foi reduzida para o limite original pela Lei 10.261/2015. Em abril do mesmo ano, o governo do estado voltou atrás na decisão e ampliou a área por meio de um decreto.
 Fica ampliada a área da Reserva Extrativista Guariba-Roosevelt, que foi criada pelo Decreto no. 9.521, de 19 de junho de 1996, localizada nos Municípios de Aripuanã e Colniza, totalizando aproximadamente 164.224,00 ha (cento e sessenta e quatro mil duzentos e vinte e quatro hectares), e perímetro de 654,74 km. Este decreto foi sustado pelo Decreto Legislativo no 51/2016, reduzindo a área da Resex para a área anterior de 57.630 hectares segundo a Lei 10261/2015. Em junho de 2017, uma decisão da Justiça, em caráter liminar, suspendeu o Decreto Legislativo no 51/2016, e volta a conter a área anterior de 164.224,00 ha. Fonte: https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/2831               
/ 
In 2015, in a decision that was later revoked by the state, the area was reduced to the original limit by Law 10,261 / 2015. In April of that same year, the state government went back on the decision and expanded the area by means of a decree.
  The area of the Guariba-Roosevelt Extractive Reserve, which was created by Decree no. 9,521, dated June 19, 1996, located in the municipalities of Aripuanã and Colniza, totaling approximately 164,224.00 ha (one hundred and sixty-four thousand two hundred twenty-four hectares), and a perimeter of 654.74 km. This decree was stopped by Legislative Decree 51/2016, reducing the area of Resex to the previous area of 57,630 hectares according to Law 10261/2015. In June 2017, a court decision, in an injunction, suspended Legislative Decree no. 51/2016, and restrained the previous area of 164,224.00 ha. Source: https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/2831

Supporting: Law 1.146, of 12/12/2002 altered the boundaries of Guajará-Mirim State Park by excluding 4,906 hectares in the northern region of the Park in order to make way for the federal highway BR-421, which was opened illegally by loggers and ranchers. As an offset to the loss, the same law adds 14,325 hectares in the southeast of the park (Subarea 2.2) in part of the area removed by Law No. 700/96. This second law however was suspended by an injunction from the Federal Court, because of disagreement with Complementary Law n°233/2000 and other legal standards.

allnames: Parque Nacional da Serra da Canastra
Supporting:
This bill (PL 6905/2010) aims to downgrade 9356.87 hectares of Serra da Canasta National Park from National Park status to Natural Monument status, to create the Rio Samburá Natural Monument. This would allow some private property ownership within the park, and would settle existing land conflicts within the Park.   
This bill is part of a three-part bill which aim to excise portions of Serra da Canasta National Park (PL147/2007), and transform these excised areas into an Environmental Protection Area Serra Canasta (PL1517/2007, now PL 147/2010), and Natural Monument Rio Sambura (PL 6905/2010). These bills are presented separately, and are in different stages of the legislative process as of June 2013. Bills 1448 and 1517 (now PL147/2010) were approved in late 2010 and are now waiting approval at the Federal Senate, where they may still be altered or refused by its members (Bueno et al. 2012)  The Natural Monument just outlined is almost entirely in the city of Medeiros, with small extent Ibiá. The authors argue that this bill will settle the conflicting land claims within the Park, and more fully protect the conservation area.   
However, others argue that this bill is a political ploy to get around the legal conflicts of the existence of mining holdings within that National Park (Bueno et al 2012). Bueno et al. cites the existence of 105 mining permits within the Park, and highlights how 58 of these are found within the area Proposed to be excised from the Park. See Bueno et al. for a map of the region, and more details

On August 14, 2019 Senate approved a requisiton to the bill to be returned to the Câmara dos Deputados so a public audience can be carried out. The bill processing in Senate is halted.

This entry was merged with entries BRA0103 and BRA0104 as PL1448/2007 and PL 1517/2007 and PL 6905/2010 were eventually analysed together in Senate, and by a nominated work group and only one shapefile depicting the proposals merged together could be obtained. Proposals PL1448/2007 and PL 1517/2007 were archived definitely at the end of the 2018 term. Proposal 6905/2010, wich creates Natural Monument Rio Sambura is still going through legislative analysis as of October 2019.

Supporting: The MP758/2016 bill downsized Jamanxim National Park by 862 ha, so that it could be the bed and domain strips of the EF170 Ferrogrão railroad and BR163 highway. This portion of the bill was enacted. In the bill's earlier stages, it included a provision that would upgrade 51,135ha of land currently within the APA Tapajos to be included within Jamanxim National Park. However, this provision was vetoed before signing (Instituto Socioambiental, 2016).

O presidente Michel Temer assinou o veto integral da Medida Provisória (MP) 756 e parcial da MP 758. Os vetos devem ser publicados no Diário Oficial da União amanhã (20/6). As duas medidas reduzem florestas protegidas no Pará e em Santa Catarina. O veto manteve apenas a desafetação de trecho do Parque Nacional do Jamanxim (PA) sobreposto ao projeto da ferrovia conhecida como \Ferrogrão\". Fonte: https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/veto-nao-garante-protecao-de-floresta

PADDD_ID: President Michel Temer has signed the full veto of Provisional Measure (MP) 756 and partial of MP 758. The vetoes must be published in the Official Gazette tomorrow (20/6). The two measures reduce protected forests in Pará and Santa Catarina. The veto maintained only the disaffection of the stretch of the National Park of the Jamanxim (PA) superimposed on the project of the railroad known as \"Ferrogrão\". Source: https://www.socioambiental.org/en/noticias-socioambientais/veto-nao-garante-protecao-de-floresta"

Supporting: A June 2008 bill (PL 7708) changed the category of Pontões Capixabas National Park to a Natural Monument, a category which permits people living inside its boundaries, as long as it is in line with the Monument's management plan (Bourscheit 2009, Gov. of Brazil 2008). Authors of the bill argued that the Natural Monument category would preserve local culture and avoid conflicts with the local populace, while still preserving nature (Gov. of Brazil 2008).  ORIGINAL TEXT: o Parque Nacional dos Pontões Capixabas (ES) teve sua categoria alterada em junho de 2008, passando a ser reconhecido como monumento natural, área de proteção integral que tolera populações em seu interior.

primarynam: Bacia do Rio São Bartolomeu Environmental Protection Area
allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental da Bacia do Rio São Bartolomeu
Supporting: In 1996, this law (nº 9.262) downgraded Bacia do Rio São Bartolomeu Environmental Protection Area by transferring its managment responsibility from IBAMA, Brazil's national environmental agency, to the Distrito Federal, a more local level government. The aim of this transfer was to allow the subdivision and sale of parts of the reserve to allow private development. This streamlined the development of condominiums which benefited over 200,000 people (as stated in PL 1626 / 2007).

primarynam: Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park
allnames: Parque Estadual Rio Negro Setor Sul
Supporting:
Law 4015, 03/24/2014: Alters the boundaries of the PES Rio Negro Sector South and the APA left bank of Rio Negro (Sector Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and creates the RDS Puranga Conquest. Pes, which previously had 157,807 hectares (ISA area 154,662 hectares) now has 86,601 hectares.
Original text: “Altera os limites do PES Rio Negro Setor Sul e da APA Margem esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) e cria a RDS Puranga Conquista. O Pes, que anteriormente tinha 157.807 hectares (área ISA 154.662 hectares) passa a ter 86.601 hectares.” (https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/5545)
In 2005, Brazil's Rural Agriculture Agency (INCRA) instituted the Sustainable Development Project Cuieiras/Anavilhanas (also known as called Cuieiras - Apuaú) in the northern half of Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park. Then, in 2010, Lei 3.572 (28/12/2010) authorized the Governor to transform the areas of the park used by traditional communities into a lower protected area category: Reserva de Desenvolvimento Sustentável. As of May 2013, a proposal is under consideration that would downgrade half of Rio Negro State Park to form a Sustainable Development Reserve, in order to restore use rights to traditional populations living within the Park that depend directly on the extraction of natural resources. To be exact, the proposal would make the area of Rio Negro State Park to be 77,950 hectares, and the new Reserva de Desenvolvimento Sustentável Cuieiras to be 86,233 hectares. This means that 86,233 ha of the original Park area is proposed to be downgraded to a lower protected status.
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Conservation Biology       ;         MMA. N.d. allnames: Parque Nacional da Chapada das Mesas
Supporting:
This bill changes the category of protected Chapada das Mesas from a National Park to an Extractive Reserve. Chapada das Mesas National Park was created by Presidential Decree on December 12, 2005 with an area of approximately 160,000 ha. The authors of the bill argue that the designation of the area as a National Park infringes on the rights of the 400 families currently living within the Park. They argue that the Proposed change in category will pacify local populations, whom are currently in conflict with the Park service over their rights to use the land (Dutra 2010).

allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental Nhamundá; Área de Proteção Ambiental Guajuma; Parque Estadual Nhamundá (nome anterior)
Supporting: Nhamundá State Park was downgraded from strict protection to sustainable use category, and had its name changed to Guajuma Environmental Protection Area. This new designation allowed the passage of Tucuruí electrical line. Also, this region is known to have many mineral deposits, and studies are underway to explore the area for mineral exploitation (Vandre 2011).  PES Nhamundá, passou do status de proteção integral para de uso sustentável, agora chamada de APA Guajuma. A alteração permite a passagem do Linhão de Tucuruí, que irá levar energia elétrica do Pará até Manaus. A fronteira da APA Guajuma tem grande potencial de mineração, especialmente de exploração de bauxita e calcário (Vandre 2011)
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Region: que é dominada por interesses do agronegócio
Country: aprovou por unanimidade uma lei revogando as 11 reservas
ISO3166: mas em julho o judiciário derrubou a lei que extinguiu as reservas [3]. Nesse meio tempo
WDPAID: o governador que criou as reservas deixou o cargo para concorrer ao Senado Federal. De acordo com o chefe da Secretaria do Desenvolvimento Ambiental do governo estadual
Location_K: os deputados estaduais chegaram a um acordo com o novo governador: eles liberariam os fundos necessários para pagar os funcionários do governo estadual se o governador aprovasse a revogação da maior reserva — a Estação Ecológica Soldados da Borracha
PACODE: de 178.948 ha [4]. Na manhã de 25 de setembro
primarynam: o governador apresentou um projeto de lei ao legislativo propondo a revogação dessa reserva
allnames: mas os legisladores imediatamente acrescentaram uma emenda ao projeto de lei
EventType: extinguindo também as outras dez áreas protegidas
EnactedPro: e naquela mesma tarde aprovaram a lei que extinguiu todos os 11 reservas sem debate
YearPAGaze: bem como sem qualquer consulta pública ou estudo técnico [4]. Nos discursos celebrando a votação
YearPADDD: um dos líderes da Assembléia Legislativa declarou explicitamente que a Assembléia Legislativa é composta de “deputados ruralistas que têm compromissos com a sociedade de uma maneira geral do Estado de Rondônia
Cause: mas principalmente com o agronegócio” [4]. Em 5 de outubro
Areaaffect: um grupo de 60 organizações não governamentais solicitou ao governador que vetasse a lei em sua totalidade [5]. Em 16 de outubro
Size_Pre: o governador emitiu um veto parcial
Size_Post: aprovando a revogação da Estação Ecológica Soldados da Borracha
IUCN_pre: mas rejeitando as cláusulas que extinguem as outras dez reservas [6]. A assembléia legislativa agora tem 30 dias úteis para votar a anulação do veto [7]. Dada à unanimidade dos votos anteriores

allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental do Rio Madeira
Supporting: Dispõe sobre a exclusão de áreas da Estação Ecológica Estadual Serra Três Ir-mãos, da Área de Proteção Ambiental Rio Madeira, da Floresta Estadual de Rendi-mento Sustentado do Rio Vermelho - C e da Reserva Extrativista Jacy-Paraná edestina tais áreas para formação do lago artificial da barragem da Usina Hidrelétri-ca de Santo Antônio. Fica excluída da Área de Proteção Ambiental Rio Madeira, localizada no Município de Porto Velho e criada pelo Decreto no 5.124, 6 dejunho de 1991, área de 797,9222 hectares. A Área de Proteção Ambiental RioMadeira passa a ter área de 5.554,0884 hectares. / It deals with the exclusion of areas of the Serra Três Ir-manos State Ecological Station, the Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area, the Rio Vermelho-C Sustained Income Forest and the Jacy-Paraná Extractive Reserve. artificial lake of the dam of the Santo Antônio Hydroelectric Power Plant. It is excluded from the Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area, located in the Municipality of Porto Velho and created by Decree 5,124, June 6, 1991, an area of 797,9222 hectares. The Rio Madeira Environmental Protection Area now has an area of 5,554,0884 hectares.

Esta alteração de área representou, nesta dimensão, uma variação de decimais de hectares. / Amends Decree n. 5.124, dated June 6, 1991, excluding and including areas, in the Environmental Protection Area - APA Rio Madeira. Altera o Decreto n. 5.124, de 6 de junho de 1991, excluindo e incluindo áreas, na Área de Proteção Ambiental - APA Rio Madeira. Amends Decree n. 5.124, dated June 6, 1991, excluding and including areas, in the Environmental Protection Area - APA Rio Madeira. It excludes an area of 32,348,23m² (3,2348 ha) and includes an area of 36,384,11m² (3,6384 ha). This change of area represented, in this dimension, a variation of decimals of hectares. In relation to the ISA area it went from 6,431 hectares to 6,443 hectares.

allnames: Reserva de Desenvolvimento Sustentável Mamirauá; Estação Ecológica de Mamirauá (nome anterior)
Supporting: Mamirauá was first created as an Ecological Station in 1990 (Decreto 12.836 de 09/03/1990). In 1996, it was downgraded and transformed into Brazil's first Sustainable Development Reserve created by decree of the Governor of Amazonas. The proposal of a Sustainable Development Reserve is to reconcile biodiversity conservation with sustainable development in a unit also inhabited by human populations. Census data from 2011 Mamirauá indicate the existence of 1,873 households with 10,867 people, including residents and users of the reserve. The local economy of the residents and users of the reserve is based on a combination of subsistence production of basic items of food (fish and manioc flour) and an output, little intensive for sale, consists of the same items and, to a lesser extent, alligator meat. Riverine communities in the reserve are organized into 9 sectors. Every industry convenes periodic meetings in which proposals are discussed use of resources found in the area under their responsibility.
Sources: Instituto Mamirauá. http://www.mamiraua.org.br/pt-br   ;   Instituto Socioambiental. RDS Mamiraua. http://uc.socioambiental.org/pt-br/uc/4111

primarynam: Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo Biological Reserve
allnames: Reserva Biológica Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo
Supporting:
Reversal: Arquivada ao final da Legislatura (art. 332 do RISF) em 20 dez 2018
This bill (PL258/2009) aims to downgrade Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo from a Biological Reserve to a National Park, and also excise 162,000 ha from the Reserve in order to create Vale do XV Environmental Protection Area, a classification which allows more human development. In summary, the bill would divide the Biological Reserve into a 1780 km2 National Park and a 1620 km2 Environmental Protection Area, leaving over 24.7 km2 to be removed from the Reserve entirely.   The authors argue that Biological Reserve was created without adequate public consultation and study, resulting in conflicting land claims. They contend that it is a productive region that would be best used for rural development, and also that the Reserve does not contain significant biological resources that merit protection.  The Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo Biological Reserve (REBIO) was created by decree on May 20, 2005, and is located less than 100 km from the BR 163 highway. This range is within the limits established by the Federal Government in 1970 for colonization surrounding the highway. In 2005, the BR 163 region already had 19 counties and a population of over 845,000. This highway was designed to coincide with fertile land, in order to encourage families to relocate there, establish infrastructure and develop the region. Thus, the authors argue that the Reserve should be used for development. The bill is currently under consideration by the Comissão de Meio Ambiente, Defesa do Consumidor e Fiscalização e Controle, and is also open to public comment as of September 2011. O projeto está sob consideração pela Comissão de Meio Ambiente, Defesa do Consumidor e Fiscalização e Controle em 27/04/2017, a matéria está com a relatoria.

Supporting: This bill ( PL Nº 3.436/2012 ) would downgrade Cercadinho Ecological Station by allowing infrastructure development between 2 highways. The authors claim that this infrastructure would benefit the public interest and not pollute the driving water that the Ecological Station was designed to protect. The bill is currently pending in Congress. Cercadinho Ecological Station was created in 2006 with 224.8933ha (Lei nº 15.979, de 13 de janeiro de 2006). The bill states \It is permitted to use the area of the ecological station of this Law for the implementation of infrastructure interconnection and access to the highway BR-356 and MG-030 highway..\" (almg.gov.br 2012)

Supporting: Candeias State Park was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al. 2010). This agreement between the federal government and Rondônia was signed on 2 June 2009 and ruled that Bom Futuro's 272,000 hectares of National Forest would be converted into three distinct areas: one 70,000 ha Environmental Protected Area (APA), one 70,000 ha State Forest to be administered by the State of Rondônia, and one 132,000 ha Federal protected area to be managed by the Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity (ICMBio). In return, the state would transfer to the Union 180,000 ha for the  creation of the Federal protected area This new Federal protected area would result from the sum of four units:. Rio Vermelho State forests A and B, and the Ecological Stations of Serra dos Três Irmãos and Antonio Mujica Nava. In summary, the federal government wanted to speed up the states' permitting and licensing of the Jirau hydroelectric project (MPF/RO 2010).
Sources: Bernard, E., Penna, L., & Araújo, E. (2014). Downgrading, Downsizing, Degazettement, and Reclassification of Protected Areas in Brazil. Conservation Biology    ;  Estado de Rodonia. 2010. Supporting:
This law (no. 11.285 of 2006), first proposed in 2004 as PL4186, altered the boundaries of Brasilia National Park. At the Park’s founding, it had an area of 30,000 hectares. The 2006 law increased its area to 42389.01 hectares, while also excising a portion of the Park currently settled by humans.   The authors argue that because the Park’s boundaries were not described well by law upon its creation in 1961 (Decree No. 241), several conflicting land claims arose. Many people settled illegally within the National Park.    In addition, there have been requests since the 1970s to expand the Park area on its northwestern boundary, in order to incorporate new environments within the Park, improving the ecological representativeness, connectivity, and wildlife habitat within the Park.    
However, critics state that this bill favors real estate speculation, and also set a dangerous precedent of altering the Park's boundaries to suit special interests. This bill excised a human settlement from the Park, and simultaneously expanded its boundaries by over 12,000 ha.
Sources: Presidência da República. Lei no 11.285. Altera of limites do Parque Nacional de Brasilia. (2006). primarynam: Antônio Mujica Nava State Ecological Station
allnames: Estação Ecológica Estadual Antônio Mugica Nava
Supporting: Antônio Mujica Nava State Ecological Station was degazetted in 2010, and the area was incorporated into Mapinguari National Park, under an agreement between the President and the governor of Rodonia, to exchange changes in protected areas for the establishment of the Jirau hydroelectric project (Instituto Socioambiental 2013). A map of the Rodonia protected areas affected by by Lei Complentar no. 581, among other laws, can be found here: http://site-antigo.socioambiental.org/nsa/detalhe?id=3135  .   This agreement between the federal government and Rondônia was signed on 2 June 2009 and ruled that Bom Futuro's 272,000 hectares of National Forest would be converted into three distinct areas: one 70,000 ha Environmental Protected Area (APA), one 70,000 ha State Forest to be administered by the State of Rondônia, and one 132,000 ha Federal protected area to be managed by the Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity (ICMBio). In return, the state would transfer to the Union 180,000 ha for the  creation of the Federal protected area This new Federal protected area would result from the sum of four units:. Rio Vermelho State forests A and B, and the Ecological Stations of Serra dos Três Irmãos and Antonio Mujica Nava. In summary, the federal government wanted to speed up the states' permitting and licensing of the Jirau hydroelectric project (MPF/RO 2010). The bill, Lei Complementar Nº 581 de 30/06/2010, states that \Art.  4º.  Ficam  revogados  os  seguintes Decretos: I  –  Decretos  nº 4574

Supporting:
In this bill, Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  

The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009)    On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.

Cause: ICMBio, Brazil's managing body for protected areas, proposes to alter the boundaries of Serra dos Orgãos National Park, in order to excise 216 hectares of land previously settled and degraded by agricultural communities.  When the Park was created in 1939 (Nov. 30) by decree 1,822, it  included the rural community of Bonfim (near Petropolis) within its boundaries. ICMBio now claims that this now-degraded region does not have natural characteristics to justify its inclusion in the Park, and that these rural settlements should not be included within its boundaries. These excisions will be offset by including new areas to the Park, with similar areas (see map in ICMBio n.d.)  As of July 2013, the proposal was open for public comment. Serra dos Orgaos is one of the first national parks created in Brazil, established in 1939\ (Mittermeir et al. 2005)"

Supporting:
Although created in 1990 with the extension of 586,031 ha (Decree 4576 of 23/03/90), the issuance of purchase and sale ( CPCVs ) by INCRA in 1991 /1992, contracts resulted in a reduction of 152,215 ha of park land which originally protected the headwaters of the rivers that drain into the Park. Then, in 1996, the Legislature approved the Rondônia State Law no. 690 of 12.27.96 , which reduced the area of the park to 424,339 hectares, in order to legitimize the rural settlements whom had settled within the Park boundaries.
In 2002 , the Park was downsized again. On the last day of the term of former governor of Rondônia , Jose de Abreu Bianco , the Legislature approved the State Law no. 1,171 of 31/12/02 , excluding over 40,284 hectares of the park, to the benefit of large rural property owners. The 1996 and 2002 reductions in Corumbiara State Park total 201,975 hectares, representing 34 % of the original area of the conservation unit . The bills were approved in the absence of environmental impact studies (Instituto Socioambiental n.d.)

This bill proposes to excise 2837.47 ha of human-occupied and altered land in Serra da Papagaio State Park, while offsetting the loss by adding 4993.62 ha to the Park area. This makes the total area 26116.86 ha. The park was created by  Decree No. 39,793 , of 5 August 1998.

Reversal: Law 21555/2014 was declared unconstitutional as the final text that was published was changed from the original proposition regarding Serra do Papagaio State Park that was approved. The final text  published law refered to changes in the perimeter of Arêdes State Ecological Station. (https://www.almg.gov.br/consulte/legislacao/completa/completa.html?ano=2014&num=21555&tipo=LEI)

Ficam retificados os limites físicos do Pes Monte Alegre (PEMA) e da APA Paytuna), para o ns de adequação à Consulta Pública realizada em 18 de junho de 2001, na Cidade de Monte Alegre. O Pes Monte Alegre possui uma área com forma de um polígono irregular, envolvendo uma superfície de 36,78 Km² (3.678 ha) e perímetro de 30.081,44 m. São acrescentados à APA Paytuna 21,22 Km² (2.122 ha) que pertencia ao Pes, assim a APA Paytuna que passa a ter uma superfície de 582,51 km² (58.251 ha) e perímetro de 147.729 m. O Pes possuía até então 5.800 hectares, segundo Lei Estadual 6412/2001 (área ISA: 5.687 hectares) e a APA 56.129 hectares (área ISA: 60.985 hectares). Fonte: https://uc.socioambiental.org/uc/4691

Supporting:
This bill was passed by Congress, and then vetoed by President Temer. However, the Environmental Ministry presented a a new draftt bill the same week as the veto, including the same content (reduction of 480,000 ha from the Jamanxim National Forest) - so this is still a proposal. This proposed bill would enact the following changes: 1) Jamanxim National Forest (FLONA) - Reduced from 1,301,120 hectares to 557,580 hectares, yielding areas for Parna do Rio Novo and APA do Jamanxim (FLONA Jamanxim was created by Decreto - s/n - 13/02/2006, with a starting area of 1,301,120ha)
2) Rio Novo National Park - Enlarged from 537,757 hectares to 976,525 hectares, incorporating 438,768 hectares of Flona do Jamanxim.
3) Environmental Protection Area of ​​Jamanxim - Created by MP with 542,309 hectares under lands previously belonging to Flona do Jamanxim. In summary, 3047.72km2 of land was downgraded from FLONA Jamanxim to APA Jamanxim (newly created by this MP bill),, and 4387.68km2 of this FLONA Jamanxim was added to PARNA de Rio Novo (this land was therefore upgraded). Background: The APA was created in an area that formerly belonged to the FLONA Jamanxim characterized by widespread illegal occupation, although it was announced with the objective of protecting the sources, regulating the use of water resources, ordering and regularizing the occupation process in the region, theoretically guaranteeing the Rational use of natural resources. For the creation of APA Jamanxim, with an approximate area of ​​542 thousand hectares, Flona do Jamanxim was reduced from 1.3 million hectares to approximately 557 thousand hectares. MP also expanded the Parna Rio Novo on 438.7 thousand hectares, including land previously belonging to Flona...The creation of these PAs was one of the few measures implemented in the Sustainable BR-163 Plan in 2005, which provided for a package of mitigation measures for the impacts of road paving...In November, the Federal Public Prosecution Service (MPF) filed an action to suspend the processing of any administrative proceeding or request that aimed to recategorize, decrease or disempower Flona. \Environmental Protection Area is the one that most admits human intervention
Sources: \" states the prosecutor of the Republic Janaína Andrade de Sousa. \"The rest of the space will be allocated to farmers who pressure the government since the creation of the forest in 2006
Map_Sources: the intention is to end a conflict with the local society that has been spreading for years. Some local farmers have never accepted the creation of Flona. The invasion of the area has been intensifying since 2012
Notes: despite being opposed by environmental agencies. In 2015
Date_Add: a military police officer was killed during a surveillance operation in Flona.

Region: the average occupant of Flona Jamanxim claims an area of ​​more than 1
ISO3166: which is more than 18 times the average size of the Property normally attributed to family farming. Most of the 257 occupants of Flona arrived in the area at the time of the creation of the area....If the intention of MP 756 is not sufficiently clear
WDPAID: the reading of article 8 clarifies the target public of the same: \"The rural areas occupied and incident in the Environmental Protection Area of ​​Jamanxim can be regularized in accordance with Law No. 11.952
primarynam: respecting the minimum fraction of installments and the limit of fifteen fiscal modules and not exceeding 1
EventType: 2016). ....................\"The agency’s 2009 study assessed the speculators’ demand to shrink Flona
YearPADDD: that 67 percent of the land holdings within the unit had been created after the creation of the Flona in 2006
Cause: and that 60 percent of the new “residents” didn’t live on their plots. In other words
Areaaffect: wealthy land grabbers had been hard at work to seize

PADDD_ID: ICMBio’s conclusion: a Flona reduction “would lead to a serious setback in the government’s conservation strategy that would have unpredictable consequences
GeoDataTyp: not just for the area of the Flona itself
Region: but also for various other conservation units in Amazonia
Country: which would inevitably suffer from pressure from landowners

Region: recommend that small adjustments be made to satisfy the land claims of peasant families living there before 2006. It recommended that an area of 35
ISO3166: 500 acres) — 3.7 percent of the total — be removed from the Flona for them. This wasn’t what the speculators wanted and they went on pressuring the government
WDPAID: while continuing to illegally occupy large areas of the Flona.

PADDD_ID: IBAMA and ICMBio pushed back and tried to regain control of the unit. In 2008 and 2009 they undertook large scale enforcement operations
GeoDataTyp: even confiscating cattle reared within the Flona. As a result
Region: forest cutting within the unit declined markedly in 2010
Country: 2011 and 2012. IBAMA and ICMBio continued running one-off operations
ISO3166: but couldn’t stop the rising tide of land crime. Imazon
Location_K: showed that by 2016 that the average size of a private holding in the Flona had jumped to 1
allnames: a far bigger holding than any peasant family would occupy.

PADDD_ID: There were many violent conflicts. For instance
Region: when an IBAMA team went to the Flona to battle illegal logging

They met regularly in Novo Progresso and organized trips to Brasilia to talk with the bancada ruralista
Location_K: with the support of the minister of the environment
primarynam: signed interim measures MP 756 and MP 758. The actions eliminated part of Flona Jamanxim
allnames: reclassifying the area demanded by the landowners as an Area of Environmental Protection (APA)

O veto manteve apenas a desafetação de trecho do Parque Nacional do Jamanxim (PA) sobreposto ao projeto da ferrovia conhecida como \Ferrogrão\". O veto pode ser considerado uma vitória para o meio ambiente. O problema é que o ministro do Meio Ambiente

allnames: Área de Proteção Ambiental do Tapajós
Supporting:
In this bill, Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  

The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009)    On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.   
  

ORIGINAL TEXT: \Susta os efeitos dos decretos de 13 de fevereiro de 2006

Data_Status: o Parque Nacional do Jamanxim e o Parque Nacional do Rio Novo e do decreto de 13 de fevereiro de 2006 que amplia o Parque Nacional da Amazônia
Peer_Reviewed: no Estado do Pará….  Em resumo: num mesmo dia

primarynam: Rio Negro Setor Sul State Park
allnames: Parque Estadual Rio Negro Setor Sul (AM)
Supporting: This bill altered the boundaries of PES Rio Negro Setor Sul and APA Margem Esquerda do Rio Negro (Setor Aturiá-Apuauzinho) and created the RDS Puranga Conquista.  The PES, which formerly had an area of 157,807 hectares (UCSocioambiental data; area was 154,662 ha according to ISA) now has an area of 86,601 hectares, which constitutes a downsize of 71,206 ha.This downsize occured when a 2001 bill that had expanded the park was revoked in March 2014 by Law 4015 (24/03/2014). The newly created RDS Puranga Conquista was created for the subsistence use of traditional populations. New map shown on ISA's website (2014).
Sources: ISA. PES do Rio Negro Setor Sul.UCSocioambiental. http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/5545   ;  Diario Oficial. Lei 4015. 2014. March 24. Available from http://uc.socioambiental.org/anexos/1466_20140401_142743.pdf

Supporting:
The authors of this bill propose to downgrade Sagarana from its current status as an Ecological Station, to a State Park. The authors claim that Sagarana should be transformed to a State Park in order to allow development for tourism and the promotion of educational workshops and conferences that would bring in guests to the nearby State Forest Insititute.  The author also mentions that the region was used for Agrarian Reform in the past, and currently has a population of about 500 inhabitants, who live largely off of dairy farming.

primarynam: Nascentes do Rio Parnaíba National Park
allnames: Parque Nacional das Nascentes do Rio Parnaíba
Supporting:
This bill proposes to change the limits of Nascentes do Rio Parnaíba National Park, in the states of Piauí, Maranhão, Bahia and Tocantins. The Park was created via decree on 16 of July 2002 with an area of 729,813 ha. The area Proposed to be excised is in the south of the National Park and consists of typical tropical savannah (“cerrado”) vegetation in different degrees of recovery. The bill does not show a map of the area to be excised. The authors of the bill argue that the area has been used for agriculture, and that the Park boundaries were not demarcated until recently, which hindered the management of the Park.   The bill argues that although the Proposed excision would remove some areas of native cerrado vegetation, it would adjust the Park limits to better reflect the reality of land use in the region. Also, it would maintain protection for a minimum area of 1.5 km along the edges of the plateaus. The authors also proposes areas for expansion, of approximately 718,650 hectares, in order to offset the loss.  The predominant vegetation of the Park is classified as tropical savannah (“cerrado”). The Park is home to several macaw species, harpy eagle, giant anteater, armadillos, red brocket deer, and possibly ocelots and pumas. The bill is was approved by the Commission on Labor, Public Service and Administration, and is awaiting an opinion from the Commission on the Environment and Sustainable Development. 
Transformado na Lei Ordinária 13090/2015.
Sources: Marquezelli, N. D. S. Projeto de Lei 2618 de 2011. Nascentes do Rio Parnaiba. (2011). primarynam: Rio Mequéns State Sustainable Yield Forest
Supporting:
Rio Mequéns State Sustainable Yield Forest was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Imazon 2010). During the degazettement, however, a portion (508km2) of the reserve was incorporated into Parque Estadual Corumbiara. See following explanation from the current PE Corumbiara website ( http://uc.socioambiental.org/en/uc/2210 ):  
“Até 2010 apresentava 50.800 ha de sobreposição com a FLORSU do Rio Mequéns, revogada pela Lei Complementar Estadual N 586, de julho/2010.\",Bernard

Supporting:
In this bill, Congressman Asdrubal Bentes proposes to overturn the Presidential decree of 13 February 2006, which created the Tapajós Environmental Protection Area, Amana National Forest, Crepori National Forest, Jamanxim National Forest, Trairão  National Forest, Jamanzim National Park, and Rio Novo National Park, and expanded Amazônia  National Park by 150,000 ha (previous area was 9995.74 sq. km.) (Bourscheit 2009, Environment News Service 2006).     The protected areas are intended to ensure that the planned paving of highway BR-163 does not result in uncontrolled increase of logging on lands bordering the road, as has historically occurred throughout Amazonia. (Environment News Service 2006).  

The bill argues that the president overstepped the limits of executive power when he created these protected areas and expropriated the lands without fully consulting Congress nor the State government of Pará. Furthermore, he states that these areas lacked prior feasibility and technical studies (Bourscheit 2009)    On February 13, 2006, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed decrees expanding Amazon National Park and creating seven new environmental protected areas in the western part of Para state, a region marked by land disputes and environmental devastation.

primarynam: Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo Biological Reserve
allnames: Reserva Biológica Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo
Supporting:
O senador Cidinho Santos (PR/MT) votou favorável ao relatório do deputado federal José Priante (PMDB/PA) para a transformação da Reserva Biológica (Rebio) Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo em duas unidades de conservação de categorias distintas: Parque Nacional e Área de Proteção Ambiental. A reserva é objeto da Medida Provisória 756/2016 e a mudança é fruto de uma emenda do senador Flexa Ribeiro (PSDB/PA), aglutinada com uma emenda apresentada por Cidinho.
Assim, a parte da Rebio que conta com maior ocupação humana será categorizada como Área de Proteção Ambiental, e a outra parte, com menor índice ocupacional e com grande biodiversidade a ser preservada, será classificada como Parque Nacional, onde a posse e domínio das terras são públicos, sendo permitida a visitação pública para fins de educação ambiental, recreação e ecoturismo, sob a administração do ICMBIO (Instituto Chico Mendes de Conservação da Biodiversidade). Fonte: http://www.folhamax.com.br/cidades/cidinho-vota-a-favor-regularizacao-da-reserva-biologica-nascentes-da-serra-do-cachimbo/121031 
A redação original da MP 756, enviada pelo governo ao Congresso no fim de 2016, transformava 300 mil hectares da Floresta Nacional (Flona) do Jamanxim em Área de Proteção Ambiental (APA). Em seu relatório, Priante acabou ampliando a área da Flona que seria transformada em APA e deu o mesmo destino para parte da Reserva Biológica (Rebio) Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo, na mesma região, ampliando para 660 mil hectares a extensão que pode ter seu grau de proteção reduzido (saiba mais). Fonte: https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/congressistas-colocam-em-risco-1-milhao-de-hectares-de-floresta-no-oeste-do-para 
Conforme o parecer, a Flona perderia agora 480 mil hectares. Priante também acata uma emenda do senador Flexa Ribeiro (PSDB-PA), presidente da comissão, para reduzir a Reserva Biológica (Rebio) Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo, no sul do Pará, em 180 mil hectares, também para a criação de uma APA. Fonte: https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/parlamentares-pretendem-reduzir-protecao-de-florestas-em-votacao-nesta-terca 
A Reserva Biológica Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo também é recategorizada e passa a ser parte Parque Nacional Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo, localizado nos Municípios de Altamira e Novo Progresso, no Pará, e parte Área de Proteção Ambiental Vale do XV, no Município de Altamira. As áreas de posse incidentes na APA do Vale do XV também poderão ser regularizadas. Fonte: http://amazonia.org.br/2017/04/senado-julga-medida-provisoria-que-coloca-em-risco-660-mil-hectares-de-areas-protegidas-da-amazonia/ 
/ Senator Cidinho Santos (PR / MT) voted in favor of the report of federal deputy José Priante (PMDB / PA) for the transformation of the Nacho Biological Reserve (Rebio) of the Serra do Cachimbo into two conservation units of different categories: National Park and Area of Environmental Protection. The reserve is the subject of Provisional Measure 756/2016 and the change is the result of an amendment of Senator Flexa Ribeiro (PSDB / PA), bound by an amendment presented by Cidinho.
Thus, the part of Rebio that has the greatest human occupation will be classified as an Environmental Protection Area, and the other part, with a lower occupational index and with great biodiversity to be preserved, will be classified as National Park, where ownership and control of lands are public, and public visitation is allowed for environmental education, recreation and ecotourism purposes, under the administration of ICMBIO (Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity Conservation). Source: http://www.folhamax.com.br/cidades/cidinho-vota-a-favor-regularizacao-da-reserva-biologica-nascentes-da-cachimbo/121031
The original wording of MP 756, sent by the government to Congress at the end of 2016, transformed 300,000 hectares of Jamanxim National Forest (Flona) into an Environmental Protection Area (APA). In its report, Priante ended up expanding the area of ​​Flona that would be transformed into APA and gave the same destination to part of the Natural Reserve (Rebio) Springs of the Serra do Cachimbo, in the same region, extending to 660 thousand hectares the extension that can have its reduced degree of protection (learn more). Source: https://www.socioambiental.org/en/news-socioambientais/congressistas-colocam-em-risco-1-milhao-de-hectares-de-floresta-no-oeste-do-para
According to the opinion, Flona would now lose 480 thousand hectares. Priante also complies with an amendment by Senator Flexa Ribeiro (PSDB-PA), president of the commission, to reduce the Biological Reserve (Rebio) Nascente do Serra do Cachimbo, in the south of Pará, in 180,000 hectares, also for the creation of an APA . Source: https://www.socioambiental.org/en-us/noticias-socioambientais/parlamentares-retendem-reducir-proteca-de-florestas-em-votacao-nesta-terca
The Nascentes Biological Reserve of the Serra do Cachimbo is also recategorized and becomes part of the National Park Nascentes da Serra do Cachimbo, located in the Municipalities of Altamira and Novo Progresso, in Pará, and part of the Environmental Protection Area Vale do XV, in the Municipality of Altamira . The possession areas incident to the XV Valley APA may also be regularized. Source: http://amazonia.org.br/2017/04/senado-julga-medida-provisoria-que-coloca-em-risco-660-mil-hectares-de-areas-protegidas-da-amazonia/
Sources: http://www.folhamax.com.br/cidades/cidinho-vota-a-favor-regularizacao-da-reserva-biologica-nascentes-da-serra-do-cachimbo/121031 ; https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/congressistas-colocam-em-risco-1-milhao-de-hectares-de-floresta-no-oeste-do-para ; https://www.socioambiental.org/pt-br/noticias-socioambientais/parlamentares-pretendem-reduzir-protecao-de-florestas-em-votacao-nesta-terca ; http://amazonia.org.br/2017/04/senado-julga-medida-provisoria-que-coloca-em-risco-660-mil-hectares-de-areas-protegidas-da-amazonia/ ; http://www.camara.gov.br/proposicoesWeb/prop_mostrarintegra?codteor=1546302&filename=EMC+2/2017+MPV75616+%3D%3E+MPV+756/2016

Rev_Details: O presidente Michel Temer assinou o veto integral da Medida Provisória (MP) 756 e parcial da MP 758. Os vetos devem ser publicados no Diário Oficial da União amanhã (20/6). As duas medidas reduzem florestas protegidas no Pará e em Santa Catarina. O veto manteve apenas a desafetação de trecho do Parque Nacional do Jamanxim (PA) sobreposto ao projeto da ferrovia conhecida como \Ferrogrão\". Supporting:
“At the federal level, there were two cases of legislative proposals for downsizing UCs.  Senators and Federal Representatives promoted the downsizing of the FLONA (National Forest) Roraima and FLONA Bom Future through a law for converting a provisional measure, The reason for downsizing the FLONA Roraima was its overlap with the TI Yanomami (95% overlap). However, they took advantage of the opportunity to degazette 910 km2 of lands illegally allocated for settlements by INCRA (3% of the FLONA Roraima area). As compensation, INCRA donated around 750 km2 of adjacent forest land to the UC.” (Araújo and Barreto 2011)

In the enacted law the FLONA has retained 630,5km2 of the original area which had no overlap with the Yanomami land and was not converted to INCRA settlements and 1042km2 of added offset areas adjacent to the original area, totaling 167.268km2 (https://uc.socioambiental.org/arp/652)
Sources:

(http://www.siam.mg.gov.br/sla/download.pdf?idNorma=9270)
Bill PL 1.093 / 2007, authored by Adalclever Lopes, proposes to downsize Cercadinho Ecological Station in the Belvedere neighborhood section (in blocks 84 & 85), in order to develop infrastructure between 2 highways. The Ecological Station protects a water catchment and is located within the urban city of Belo Horizonte. The bill offers to offset the loss by adding additional land to the Ecological Station. According to NGOs, construction companies have an interest in the area (O Tempo 2007). Cercadinho Ecological Station was created in 2006 with 224.8933ha (Lei nº 15.979, de 13 de janeiro de 2006).

The bill was promulgated as Law 18,042;2009, and no offset was provided for.

Supporting:
This bill, PL 5.399, aims to downsize Renascer Extractive Reserve by about 13,000 hectares to restore cattle-ranching rights to rural settlements located within the Reserve. The Reserve, created by the Federal Government in 2009 (5 June), includes land traditionally used by cattle farming and agricultural communities. The authors of the bill argue that the Reserve has unjustly restricted cattle ranching, which is an economically important activity in the region. As of July 2013, the bill is pending review from the Commission on Agriculture, Livestock, Water Supply, and Rural Development.

Supporting: “The downsizing of the FLONA Bom Futuro resulted from an agreement between the government of Rondônia and the MMA (Ministry of the Environment). In 2009, the Governor of Rondônia demanded the downsizing of the FLONA Bom Futuro in order to regularize an illegal occupation. In return, he would grant a environmental permit necessary to the construction of the Jirau hydroelectric dam – a federal project. The federal government proposed the degazettement of a state UC that would be partially flooded by the undertaking and three other adjacent state UCs so as to establish another federal UC and this was granted.” (Araújo and Barreto 2011)
Sources: Araújo, E., Barreto, P., 2011. The State of the Amazon: Formal threats to Protected Areas in the Amazon.  IMAZON, Para. Retrieved from https://imazon.org.br/PDFimazon/Ingles/the_state_of_amazon/formal_threaths.pdf

primarynam: Rio São Domingos State Sustainable Yield Forest
allnames: Floresta Estadual de Rendimento Sustentável (FLORSU) do Rio São Domingos
Supporting: Rio São Domingos State Sustainable Yield Forest was degazetted in 2010, as part of an agreement between the Governor of Rodonia and the President which changed the size, and status of multiple protected areas in the state of Rondonia, in order to develop the Jirau Hydroeletric Complex in the region (Bernard et al. 2014, Verissimo et al.  2010). When the FLORSU Rio São Domingos was degazetted, however, 10.79% of its area was incorporated into REXEX Rio Cautário. So, the area affected by this PADDD event was 89.21% of the total area of the FLORSU.
